pages.title: Employment History
pages.heading: Tell us about your employment history.
pages.instructions:
Please provide your employment history for your most relevant employer during the last 18 months. This may also include your largest or most common client or business in your capacity as a gig worker, contract worker, small business owner, worker for hire, or self-employed individual. 
If you're self-employed, you are your own employer and should enter that information.

false.name: Please select one of the following reasons why you are applying for unemployment assistance.

true.name: Please select one of the following reasons why you are applying for unemployment assistance.

options.name: You are unable to work because you have been diagnosed with COVID-19 or are experiencing symptoms of COVID-19 and are seeking a medical diagnosis.
You are unable to work because a member of your household has been diagnosed with COVID-19.
You are unable to work because you are providing critical care for a family member or a member of the individual’s household who has been diagnosed with COVID-19.

You are unable to work because a child or other person in the household for which you have primary caregiving responsibility is unable to attend school or another facility that is closed as a direct result of the COVID-19 public health emergency and such school or facility care is required for you to work.
You are unable to reach your place of employment because of a quarantine imposed as a direct result of the COVID-19 public health emergency.
You are unable to reach your place of employment because you have been advised by a health care provider to self-quarantine due to concerns related to COVID-19.
You were scheduled to begin employment and are no longer able to do so as a direct result of COVID-19.
You have become the breadwinner after the primary head of household passed away as a direct result of COVID-19.
You have had to quit your job as a direct result of COVID-19.
Your place of employment is closed as a direct result of the COVID-19 public health emergency.

You are an individual who works as an independent contractor with reportable income and are unemployed, partially employed, or unable or unavailable to work because the COVID-19 public health emergency has severely limited your ability to continue performing your customary work activities, and has thereby forced you to suspend such activities.

questions.name: Are you currently receiving sick leave, paid time off, or other benefits from your employer equal to your normal salary or pay?

pages.title: Tax Info
pages.heading: We need to know about your recent tax status.

questions.name: We need your Adjusted Gross Income (AGI) from your most recent tax return to determine your benefits. Do you have your Adjusted Gross Income form on hand?
For your most recent tax filing, were you married filing jointly, married filing separately, or single?
What was your Adjusted Gross Income on your most recently filed federal tax return?
questions.instructions:
You can find your Adjusted Gross Income on your most recently filed 1040 form. It is on different lines, depending on which form you submitted:

Line 8b on Form 1040 (for tax year 2019)
Line 8b on Form 1040-SR (for tax year 2019)
Line 7 on Form 1040 (for tax year 2018)
Line 21 on Form 1040A (for tax years before 2018)
Line 4 on Form 1040EZ (for tax years before 2018)
Line 35 on Form 1040NR (for tax year 2019 or 2019)

questions.name: How many dependent children do you have?
questions.instructions:
You are entitled to receive additional benefits for any dependent child, regardless of whether the child lives with you or you claim the child on your income tax return.

A dependent child must be:

1) A natural, adopted, or step-child under the age of 18 whom you support.
2) A child under the age of 18 for whom you are the court-appointed guardian.
3) A child 18 years of age or older who is physically or developmentally disabled and incapable of working/earning wages.

NOTE: Only one parent or guardian is entitled to receive dependents’ allowance for any week of unemployment benefits.

options.name: All dependents are already claimed by another parent or guardians' unemployment benefits.

pages.title: Payment Info
pages.heading: Let's talk about how we can pay you!

questions.name: Do you wish to have Income Taxes withheld from your Unemployment Compensation?
questions.instructions: Unemployment is taxable income. If you do not withhold state or federal taxes from your benefits, you will be responsible to pay them when you file your tax return. Everyone who collects unemployment benefits will receive a 1099 detailing the total payments received and any taxes paid on that income. You may request changes to your claim’s tax deductions anytime.

options.name: Yes, I would like both ${state_name} and Federal Income Taxes withheld
Yes, I would like only Federal Income Tax withheld
Yes, I would like only ${state_name} Income Tax withheld
No, I do not want any Income Taxes withheld

questions.name: Please select a payment option.
questions.instructions:
There are two payments options for your COVID-19 Emergency Unemployment Insurance benefits:

Direct Deposit (DD), which deposits your unemployment benefits into your checking or savings account.

Electronic Payment Card (EPC), which works just like a debit card. The EPC is administered by J.P. Morgan Chase Bank. If you choose to receive your benefits via EPC, you will receive your card in the mail within 7-10 days from the date your claim is processed.

electronic-payment-card.name: Electronic Payment Card
electronic-payment-card.instructions:
Please visit this link for information on how to use your EPC card, EPC card fees/rates, and how to avoid unnecessary fees.

The monthly fee for your EPC is $0. It costs $0 to purchase items with your EPC. ATM withdrawal fees are $0 in-network, and $1.95 out of network. There are no overdraft fees.

direct-deposit.name: Account Number
direct-deposit.instructions: Please type the account number for the account where you would like your benefits to be deposited.

direct-deposit.name: Confirm Account Number
direct-deposit.instructions: Please re-type the account number for the account where you would like your benefits to be deposited.

direct-deposit.name: Routing Number
direct-deposit.instructions: Please type the routing number of your bank.
